answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Newport Beach, CA considered an ordinance earlier this year that set the franchise fee for a solid waste company at 10.5% of the franchisee's gross receipts.  I've attached a copy of the ordinance.   
I hope this helps.

answers.author: Matthew Fore
answers.text:
Monterey County's franchise fee is 10%. We recently combined two existing franchise agreements into one that covers the entire unincorporated area of approximately 22,000 residential and 2,200 commercial customers.

author: Shaun Rao
text:
Currently the City of Sugar Land has an open commercial solid waste system and is considering a closed system. What are typical franchise fees for a city that serves around 85,000 people? This would allow us to audit one or few companies instead of the 20 plus companies we currently have permitted! Any and all information is greatly appreciated!
Thanks,
Shaun
title: Closed Commercial Solid Waste Systems
